content: a friends and fellow crafters I'm still
mad chilly land of Ohio and it's inspired me to do some more ice hunter
terrain so today we're gonna do some small ice huts for our ice hunters and
let's hit that table I hope you guys enjoy these is a really cheap and cool
craft
[Applause]
I take the pot and what I'm gonna do is measure up an inch and a half and then
I'm going to kind of do a curved doorway here just by hand just eyeball it then
I'm gonna cut it out and then I'll have my doorway for the hut so it couldn't be
easier just kind of trim around there cuts out easily and you're ready for the
next step so here I have my pot and my percent water percent white glue and I'm
gonna start painting this on right and this will saturate into the pot I'll do
the outside also and you see it's getting very wet but once this dries
it'll harden up nicely now my hut here I'll dry it I'm gonna put some blue on
the top and I'm gonna use some TP and wet it and then attach it to the top so
it's kind of like draping down right get a nice drape there and I'm gonna have
some areas where it gathers okay and here's what I'm doing now so I'm gonna
use some more TP squinch it up and kind of have the area four corners there
where it gathers okay you see what I'm doing there just building that up a bit
easy to do it all four parts enemies some four tines for the cut but that'll
come later now I'm going to push in with a paintbrush end and you'll see what I'm
why I'm doing this here in a few minutes I'm gonna hit it with my pitch percent
water fifty percent white glue and that'll harden this up give me a nice
top on that Hut there accentuate that dimple layer in the gathering after that
dries up I'm going to strengthen that with some hot glue and then I'm going to
accentuate the folds and the dimples that are on the edges there and then I'm
gonna take the four tines that I cut and those are gonna be like bones like
jutting out like holding this cover over the hut right I thought that'd be kind
of a neat effect so I just glue those in with my hot glue and then I'm ready for
the next step I spray-painted the huts up flat black
and then I painted them with my craft paint my burnt umber craft paint now you
can see my boat's here that I needed for my Osiris too there's a really cool we
can check out that video and then I was like oh I forgot something okay I had a
little chimney that was gonna be on the top right and I totally forgot to put
that on so I just went back and hot glued that and you can just hand paint
it you don't have to spray it so I just put the paint of that put that on and
then I started painting it I painted it different Browns like patches of brown
right because you'll see what I'm gonna do here there's gonna be like hide
that's covering these huts they're basically hide huts and I want to give
that kind of effect about like a patchwork kind of covering so I thought
that'd be neat I also decided I want to accentuate the doorway in the base a
little bit so I went around the doorway and the base and kind of dragged some
hot glue up and that kind of gave it a little more reinforcement but also kind
of blended it in and made it look more like a crude kind of structure you know
not so much of form structure and then I went over with a like kind of a medium
brown a very wet medium brown and after that dry I hit it with a lighter tan and
I gave a really nice kind of effect on this it also makes the base look a lot
lighter than the top kind of furs that are hanging over the side right I wanted
work times it look like old whale bone so it is I wet paint a golden brown on
there and then wipe most of it off and left more color at the base and then
gave a nice effect of old whale bones the last night detail I wanted to add
was adding some black to the hut so I added black between the different brown
colors it made it look like separate furs and also done a little bit of black
under the canopy itself so separate a nice separation from the hut and the fur
canopy here I have my hut and a piece of craft foam I've cut and it's gonna be
the doorway right it's that flexible craft foam I'm just gonna find the
approximate center mark it up there so I know where it is and then I'm ready to
cut got my flap here and a bristly brush and I'm gonna paint dragged up some
burnt sienna onto the doorway give a little different coloring right and just
let that dry up then after that dries I'm gonna paint a zig-zag pattern with
some white on here it would be like a nice kind of tribal look I think on here
and that's what I'm going for so there we go I think that came out
great well let that dry up but first we'll cut that Center slot there yeah
there we go it's all ready now we got our Hut we're
gonna hot glue this uh this curtain in here and we'll just glue it to the edge
there make sure it's all set and wow that looks great I love it
you can also reinforce around the edge so make sure it wasn't come loose and
you're all ready for the table so let's hit that table take a look at it here's
the Hut study and avoid with some ice hunters let's take a closer look at it I
really think that came out great I think it really looks like a primitive Hut it
looks like something you'd make out of hides and furs and that kind of thing
and whale bones and I like that little chimney going up the doorway a flap in
the doorway just super easy and cheap to make these and these really brought a
nice element for the ice hunters to my table I was really happy with them and
glad I got to share with you guys
